definition[0]: a situation in which one computer is used by many different people at different terminals at the same time
definition[1]: the practice of owning a timeshare
definition[2]: a way for a computer to deal with more than one program at the same time, or for a telephone line to deal with more than one set of signals at the same time
example[0]: Connections are rapidly switched on a time-sharing basis.
definition[3]: when people buy a holiday home with other people so that they can each spend a period of time there every year
example[1]: the sale of time-sharing real estate units
